docs.lead_paragraph: IF 3-year-olds could read they would probably have been a littleincredulous about the recent furor in the papers over spanking. It started when the headmaster of the Cathedral Choir School here in New York, Canon Darby W. Betts, informed parents of the boys that he was instituting paddling as a punishment for demerits.

headline.main: Spanking -- The Pros, Cons and Maybes; Some of the arguments are old, some are new. Here is how they rage today.

docs.lead_paragraph: A five-year study of the aging process in the rotifer, a microscopic fresh-water animal, has provided evidence that the age of the mother determines the longevity of the offspring.

headline.main: LIFE SPAN LINKED TO MOTHER'S AGE; Study of Tiny Rotifer Shows Cut in Longevity if Parent Has Stopped Growing

docs.abstract: Dr Lansing repts study of aging process in rotifers indicates mother's age determines life span of offspring
docs.snippet: A five-year study of the aging process in the rotifer, a microscopic fresh-water animal, has provided evidence that the age of the mother determines the longevity of the offspring.
